Expectation1: Teaching children moral values and discipline
Situation1: The child is caught stealing snacks at a store, and the step-parent needs to handle the situation
Expectation2: Secure packages and confirm successful delivery
Situation2: Hand-delivering a high-value or sensitive package directly to the recipient and verifying their identity
Story:
I was still replaying the scene in my head as I pulled up to the next delivery stop. Just an hour ago, I’d caught my stepson, Jamie, slipping a candy bar into his pocket at the grocery store. My heart had sunk. As his step-parent, I knew I had to teach him right from wrong, to show him that honesty matters, even when it’s hard. But Jamie’s wide, anxious eyes made me hesitate—he’d only been living with me for a year, and I worried about pushing him away if I came down too hard.

Now, as I grabbed the high-value package from the van, my phone buzzed with a message from my partner: “We need to talk about Jamie.” I was supposed to hand-deliver this package, check the recipient’s ID, and get a signature—no mistakes allowed. My mind raced with the weight of both roles. I couldn’t let my work slip, but I also couldn’t ignore what happened with Jamie. The pressure built in my chest, torn between the responsibility to my job and the responsibility to my family, both demanding my full attention at the same time.
